p: In the Kinzig, the SARs per metric shows—similar to the SR—large increases in species assemblage abundances caused by decreasing duration of high‐flow conditions (dh4), especially for the higher‐order reaches (river order three, Figure 6k,p, Figure S5a,b). The SARs to this metric were significantly higher in downstream reaches (i.e., river order three) with mostly increased AV compared to decreased values in the upstream reaches (ANOVA, p < .01, Tukey HSD, p < .01). Most increasing trends in SARs were caused by the small increased values predicted in flood‐free periods (th3, mean values of each period: 0.83 for baseline, 0.86 for horizons 2050 and 2090), while decreasing trends (Figure 6q,m,r,n, Figure S5d,e,f) were mainly caused by increased or decreased values in the low‐flow conditions (mainly increased ml18 with the following mean values of each period: 56.0% for baseline, 63.4% for horizon 2050, and 63.0% for horizon 2090, and decreased fl1 with the following mean values: 4.4 low‐flow events for baseline and 3.8 for horizon 2090, and decreased ra4 with the following mean values: 202.3 for baseline, 197.2 for horizon 2050).
